message: the other topic got a bit off-topic, so I'm opening a new one: what the hell is a dualistic thing system?

instead of the “new-world” Paws, wherein absolutely everything (every ‘thing’) was actually implemented as a ‘routine’ (for instance, lists were linked-lists of nested ‘routines’ that called/fell-through to eachother)
That conversation started in IRC and failed to translate over, because everyone hated Convore. ;D
not fast enough, I keep having to reload to see new content, which is silly on a 12Mbit connection with average pings around 26ms.

and this is absolutely nothing like Wave; it doesn’t have the dualistic nature of “IM convo when everyone’s there, with the conversation naturally evolving into a long-form forum/e-mail convo when people have to AFK or become distracted”
it feels very Wave-y to me at least, but it's more about the feeling when I jump around in conversations
that, right there, was the best part of Wave.
and then executions (routines), which are a code type
it's kinda how I expected Wave to be
dualistic paws is more old-school, with two basic types of things in the nucleus: ‘forks’ which are a data type, like “lists”
what is a fork? something like ADT? http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algebraic_data_type
